quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Capital and State
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, mary, frost. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: From 1819 to 1839, Vandalia, the county seat of Fayette County, was the capital of which state?
Wheeling was the capital of this state from 1863 to 1870 and again from 1875 to 1885.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: West Virginia

questions.question: Mary, the betrothed wife of Joseph, gave birth to her child, Jesus in Bethlehem.
By now in New York City, theres snow on the ground
The city of Natchez, founded in 1716, was the capital of which state from 1817 to 1821?
This Scandinavian author wrote a cheerless Christmas story in which a poor girl walks barefoot along snow-covered streets on Christmas Eve.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Hans Christian Andersen

questions.question: From 1819 to 1826, Murfreesboro, famous for the Battle of Murfreesboro of 1862, was the capital of which state?
In 1862, during the American Civil War, Opelousas briefly served as capital of which state?
This line is from a Christmas song, written by Burl Ives. Which is the song?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Holly Jolly Christmas

questions.question: Before going to see baby Jesus, the wise men met Herod the Great , who wanted to kill Jesus.
Vallejo, located in the Solano County, was the capital of which state in 1852 and 1853?
From 1796 to 1806, Louisville, a city located on the Ogeechee River, was the capital of which state?
Jack Frost, a figure that presumably originated in Viking folklore, personifies crisp, cold, winter weather.
From 1810 to 1812, Zanesville, a city located in Muskingum County, was the capital of which state?
What does Frosty the Snowman, the character from an animated story produced by the Rankin-Bass company, say when he wakes up?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Happy Birthday!

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Country and Language
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, country, hrvatska. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What country is called Magyarorszag in its native language?
What country is called Hrvatska in its native language?
What country is called Suomi in its native language?
What country in West-central Europe is called Deutschland in its native language?
This country is called Österreich in its native language, which is literally translated as the eastern state?
What former Yugoslavian republic is called Crna Gora in its native language?
This country on the Balkan Peninsula is called Ellada in its native language?

This country is located in Africa.  Here you may get a hotel room for approximately $5/person, soft drinks are 20c, and dinner with drinks for $7.  The worlds largest artifical lake, Lake Volta, is located here.
What country is called Polska in its native language?
Founded in 1861, Lewiston was the territorial capital of this future state from 1863 to 1864.
Until Jefferson City was build in 1826, Saint Charles served as capital of which state?
What country is called Slovensko in its native language?
What Balkan country is called Shqiperia in its native language?
What country is called Sverige in its native language?
What country is called Eire in its native language?

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: Currency and Coins
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, sudetes, positioning. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: The Sudetes is a mountain range in Central Europe.
Mont Blanc is the second highest mountain in the world.
A window of convenience is generally considered to be this number of hours on either side of ideal departure or arrival time.
One of these types of rates does not exist.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Standby Rate

questions.question: In order to prevent jet lag you should follow this time.

options.text: Local time at the place you are flying to.
Local time at the place you took off from.
Local time at the places that the airplane passes through.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Local time at the place you are flying to.

questions.question: GPS stands for Global Positioning System.
The coupon is part of an airline ticket. This is what you do with it.

options.text: Keep it in order to prove that you have been on that flight.
Receive food on board in return for it.
It allows you to use the facilities of the airport free of charge.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Surrender it at check-in.

questions.question: Days or periods of high demand when special rates are not in effect are known as black days.
The Azores were discovered by the explorer Amerigo Vespucci.
When a hotel room is classified as Double/Double, this is true about the room.

options.text: It has two normal beds and two armchairs that can be used as two additional beds.
If you want to have the room you have to pay double.
It has two normal beds and two smaller beds for kids.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It has two double beds.

questions.question: The currency of Malta is Maltese franc.
Denmark is a monarchy.
This country has the Balboa as currency, which is the same as the Dollar. Actually the bills are US dollars and the coins are a mixture of Balboas and US coins.
The personal identification that must be attached to luggage checked by an airline is called this.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Baggage Tag

questions.question: The city of Limassol is located in Greece.

quizzes.title: Geography Quiz: City and Nicknames
quizzes.description: Test your geography knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Geography, slogan, nicknames. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: One of the following pairs (city - what it is a capital of) is wrong.

options.text: New York City - The Capital of the World
Las Vegas - Entertainment Capital of the World
Norman - Storm Capital of the World
Binghamton - Carousel Capital of the World

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Norman - Storm Capital of the World

questions.question: Does San Francisco have more nicknames than San Diego?
The U.S. city of Flagstaff is referred to as three of these nicknames. Which is the odd one?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Old Pueblo

questions.question: One of these four cities is not referred to as a big fruit.
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: New Orleans

questions.question: Look, Ma, no cavities! was the advertising slogan of which product?
City of the Plains, Convention City, and Gateway to the Rockies are just three of the alternative names of this city.
Which of these was advertised with the words Think small?
Three of these California cities have two popular nicknames each. Which city has just one?
One of Detroits nicknames is The 313, one of Flints is That 810. The number in one of Lansing, Michigan nicknames is this.
Which of these used the advertising slogan, Ring around the collar!?
We try harder was the motto of which company?
Mount Vesuvius is a volcano east of Naples, Italy.
Damascus is the capital city of Syria.
The slogan Is it true blondes have more fun was used by which company?
Jonesboro (Arkansas), Fort Wayne (Indiana) and Louisville (Kentucky) are three cities whose other names contain these buildings.

quizzes.title: Entertainment Quiz: Rudolph and Red Nosed Reindeer
quizzes.description: Test your entertainment knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering Entertainment, driving, phrase. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: What did Hermie the elf do to subdue the snowmonster in Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer?

options.text: Shaved off all of its hair.

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Removed its teeth.

questions.question: In what year did Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer first run on American television?
Which brand was advertised with this slogan: Id rather fight than switch.?
On the Island of Misfit Toys in Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer, what makes the train a misfit?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: It has square wheels.

questions.question: Which of these is not a misfit from The Island of Misfit Toys in the Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer Christmas special?

options.text: A bird that can swim but not fly

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: A cat that barks

questions.question: Which company used the advertising slogan Reach out and touch someone?
At the end of Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer, Yukon Cornelius and the snowmonster arrive at Christmastown. What job is the snowmonster given?

options.text: Puting the stars on top of trees

questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Puting the stars on top of trees

questions.question: Which of these used the tagline The ultimate driving machine?
Which of Santas eight legendary reindeer is Rudolphs father according to the Rudolph Christmas classic?
Which of Santas eight famous Reindeer was the coach of the Reindeer Games in Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer?
In Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer, on the Island of Misfit Toys there is a jack-in-the-box who acts as the island sentry. He is a misfit because his name is Hank and not Jack.
Which of these statements about the Abominable Snowmonster is false according to the Rudolph Christmas classic?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: They are very smart.

questions.question: The popular phrase Sorry, Charlie is associated with which product?
On the Island of Misfit Toys there are many unusual toys in Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer. On that island, what does the water gun shoot that makes it a misfit?
Have it your way! was the advertising slogan of which company?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: Burger King

quizzes.title: History Quiz: Ancient World and Seven Wonders
quizzes.description: Test your history knowledge with this comprehensive quiz! Features 15 questions covering History, kind, world. Includes 5 easy, 5 medium, and 5 challenging questions. Can you achieve a passing score of 70%?

questions.question: To which Greek goddess was the Temple at Ephesus dedicated?
What is the capital of South Dakota?
What is the capital of New York state?
Which of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World is the oldest?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Pyramid of Giza

questions.question: How many of the Seven Ancient World Wonders exist in the modern world?
What kind of animal did the cowboy from The Island of Misfit Toys ride in Rudolph the Red-Nosed Reindeer?
Which of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World was built on the banks of the Euphrates River in present-day Iraq?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Hanging Gardens

questions.question: Which of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World was built on the island of Rhodes?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Colossus

questions.question: Which of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World was inlaid with ivory, gold, ebony, and precious stones?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Statue of Zeus

questions.question: Which classical Greek sculptor designed the magnificent Statue of Zeus?
Two of Wonders of the Ancient World were built as tombs. Of those listed below, which was one of these tombs?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Great Pyramid of Giza

questions.question: Where was the great Statue of Zeus located?
The Colossus, one of the Seven Wonders of the Ancient World, was a giant statue of which Greek god?
For which ruler was the Mausoleum at Halicarnassus built?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: King Mausolus

questions.question: What is the other name of the Lighthouse at Alexandria?
questions.explanation: The correct answer is: The Pharos
